intro: Polygala oligophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or white and are pollinated by insects, particularly bees. Polygala oligophylla is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soil conditions.
